gosset 0.2.4

Pairwise victories

Source: R/summarise_victories.R
summarise_victories.Rd

Summarise victories from pairwise comparisons

summarise_victories(object)

# S3 method for gosset_vctr
plot(x, ...)

Arguments

object

a rankings object of class 'rankings', 'grouped_rankings' or 'paircomp'
x

an object of class 'gosset_vctr' for the plotting method. Generates a 'ggplot' object that can be passed to any ggplot2 method
...

additional arguments passed to methods. See details

Value

A data.frame with summary of victories from pairwise comparisons:

player1

the first player in the comparison

player2

the second player in the comparison

win

times player1 wins against player2

ncontest

number of contests between player1 and player2

victories

relative number of times player1 wins against player2

Details

minlength an integer, passed to abbreviate() to define the minimum length of the abbreviations

See also

Other summarise functions: summarise_agreement(), summarise_dominance(), summarise_favourite()

Examples

# breadwheat data

data("breadwheat", package = "gosset")

R <- rank_tricot(data = breadwheat,
                 items = c("variety_a", "variety_b", "variety_c"),
                 input = c("overall_best", "overall_worst"))


v <- summarise_victories(R)

p <- plot(v)

############################################################
############################################################

# beans data where each observer compares 3 varieties
# randomly distributed

library("PlackettLuce")
data("beans", package = "PlackettLuce")

R <- rank_tricot(data = beans,
                 items = c("variety_a", "variety_b", "variety_c"),
                 input = c("best", "worst"),
                 additional.rank = beans[, c("var_a", "var_b", "var_c")])

v <- summarise_victories(R)
